titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Daniel J. Gallagher Papers 1980.0002
titlestmt.author: Archives & Special Collections staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-07-25 07:41:29 -0400.

repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library

did.abstract: Collection consists of a scrapbook of newspaper clippings compiled by Gallagher documentingabout his tenure as a labor leader in Connecticut and about labor activities in Putnam, Norwich, and Willimantic, Connecticut.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Daniel J. Gallagher was the Regional Director of the Textile Workers Union of America in Norwich, Connecticut, in the mid to late 1940s and Executive Secretary of the Connecticut State Labor Council, AFL-CIO.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of a scrapbook of newspaper clippings compiled by Gallagher documenting his tenure as a labor leader in Connecticut and about labor activities in Putnam, Norwich, and Willimantic, Connecticut.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Daniel J. Gallagher Papers. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Library.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The scrapbook was donated by Mr. Gallagher in May 1980.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.
